Mother’s Day Special ✨ 
 
Looking to treat someone special on Mother’s Day this weekend? This Apple & Elderflower Spritz is the perfect refreshing sip: easy, elegant and oh-so-delicious!  I used the fragrant M&S Elderflower Liqueur made with hand-picked elderflowers as well as lemongrass and blackcurrant buds for those aromatic floral notes. And to make this cocktail extra special I used the M&S Edible Viola Flowers to make some cute sphere ice cubes.  These stunning Gin Deco glasses are also from M&S, perfect for spring and summer spritzes! 
 
Recipe
 50ml M&S Elderflower Liqueur
 50ml M&S Sparkling British Apple Spring Water (find this with the on-the-go drinks by the sandwiches and salads)
 100ml M&S Extra Dry Prosecco (you can also use 150ml if you prefer a drier spritz)
Serve over ice, stir and enjoy!

Looking for the perfect cocktail for those sunny spring days?  ☀️
 
My Gin de Cassis is delicious, refreshing and super easy to make. I’ve used the @marksandspencerfood Creme de Cassis which is fruity and indulgent, and pairs perfectly with the zesty botanical notes of their small-batch Collection Old Tom Gin. The cassis also great mixed with sparkling wine or champagne for a Kir Royale! 
 
 Gin de Cassis 
50ml M&S Collection Old Tom Gin
25ml fresh lemon juice
15ml simple syrup
Top-up with clear lemonade
15ml M&S Creme de Cassis
 
Shake the gin, lemon juice and simple syrup with ice. Serve over ice, top-up with lemonade, float with Creme de Cassis, stir and enjoy! ✨

Almond Croissant Breakfast Muffins
 
Ad a high-protein, high-fibre breakfast muffin with a gorgeous little hidden centre of oozy almond butter. So perfect for prepping, taking on the go or even enjoying as a sweat treat. These muffins are packed with M&S Eat Well ingredients, high-quality protein, heart-healthy fats, natural sweetness, and plenty of fibre—making them a perfectly balanced treat. Plus, with M&S Eat Well, it’s easy to find nutritious options in store. Simply look for the Eat Well flower on pack to enjoy better choices every day
 
291 kcal & 12g protein per muffin
 
Dry Ingredients
•⁠ ⁠110g ground almonds 
•⁠ ⁠60g oat flour (blend oats into a fine flour)
•⁠ ⁠1 tbsp ground flaxseeds
•⁠ ⁠1 tsp baking powder
•⁠ ⁠½ tsp cinnamon
•⁠ ⁠¼ tsp salt
Wet Ingredients
•⁠ ⁠200g cottage cheese (blended until smooth)
•⁠ ⁠2 heaped tbsp honey
•⁠ ⁠1 large egg
•⁠ ⁠1 tsp almond extract
•⁠ ⁠1 tbsp olive oil
 
Almond butter
Flaked almonds
 
Preheat the oven to 180C (160C fan) and line a muffin tray with 6 cases or use non stick. 
In a bowl, mix the almond flour, oat flour, flaxseeds, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt.
In a blender, blend the cottage cheese, honey, egg, almond extract, and olive oil.
Gradually fold the wet ingredients into the dry mixture until fully combined.
Spoon a little batter into each muffin case, add a little dollop of almond butter to the center, then cover with more batter.
Sprinkle flaked almonds on top of each muffin.
Bake for 15-18 minutes, until golden and risen. Allow to cool slightly before serving. Enjoy warm or store in an airtight container for up to 7 days.

Beef Short Rib Lasagna - Recipe Below - my next level lasagna is made easy with @marksandspencerfood Slow Cooked British Short Rib of Beef used as the base for the ragu. It’s part of the newly revamped Slow Cooked range, delish restaurant quality dishes that you can throw together in no time as a complete meal or use as I do as an instant time saver. Check out the range in M&S food halls or online @ocadoUK – let me know which of the range you have tried x JohnGS -ad- 

Serves 6
1 x 830g pack M&S Slow Cooked British Short Rib of Beef
1 x 500g jar and 1 x 340g jar M&S Everything Tomato Sauce 
60g butter 
60g plain flour 
500ml whole milk 
400g fresh lasagna sheets 
1 tbsp olive oil
200g Parmesan cheese, finely grated 
Salt and pepper 

1.	To make the ragu, shred the short ribs and add the meat to a saucepan. Squeeze in the packet of red wine and truffle jus and pour in the jars of everything tomato sauce. Bring to the simmer over a medium heat and cook for 10 minutes. Check the seasoning, adding salt and pepper to taste. 
2.	Meanwhile, make the bechamel. Melt the butter and add the flour. Mix well. Whisk in the milk, a little at a time, until you have a smooth sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 
3.	Get a pan of boiling water on the go and a fill a mixing bowl with cold water. Boil the lasagna sheets, 3-4 at a time, for 5-10 seconds until just soft. Transfer to the cold water to stop them cooking. Drain just before you are ready to assemble the lasagna. 
4.	Pre-heat the oven to 180c fan and grease a 24x32cm baking tin with a little olive oil. Line the sides and bottom with lasagna sheets and then add a layer of the ragu and drizzle over a little bechamel. Add plenty of cheese and then cover with lasagna sheets. Repeat with two more layers so you finish with a layer of pasta. Fold in the lasagna sheets hanging over on the sides to seal everything. Pour over the remaining bechamel and drizzle over the last few spoons of ragu. Top with more cheese and cover with foil. Bake for 40 minutes. Remove the foil and return to the oven for 8-10 minutes until the top is golden. Leave to rest for 20 minutes before serving.

Repeat with the remaining tortillas, then fry over a medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes per side or until lovely and crispy.
While they’re frying make your sauce by mixing the Greek yoghurt, chipotle paste and lime together in a bowl, season with salt and pepper, and adjust to taste.

Check out M&S Food ambassador @emthenutritionist making her High Protein Spanakopita Eggs!
 
Inspired by Turkish eggs with a spanakopita twist. If you want something quick, easy, and healthy for breakfast or lunch, this is it. Packed with Eat Well ingredients from- just look for the flower on the pack! 
 
A sprinkle of the new M&S 35+ Gut Booster Mega Mix from the Good Gut range, and juicy pomegranate seeds. Served with a warm wholegrain pita to scoop it all up.

Serves 1 
335 kcal & 32g protein

2 eggs 
120g thick Greek yoghurt (0% or full fat) 
50g spinach
1 banana shallot 
1 clove garlic
Pinch nutmeg
30g feta
1 tbsp chopped dill
Wholemeal pita to serve
Optional: pomegranate seeds and mixed seeds to serve 

Bring a pot of water to a rolling boil. Gently lower the eggs into the water and boil for 6 minutes. Transfer them immediately into a bowl of ice water to stop the cooking. Let them sit for 5 minutes, then carefully peel and set aside.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat with a drizzle of olive oil. Sauté the chopped shallot until soft. Add the minced garlic and cook for another 30 seconds. Stir in the spinach and cook until wilted. Remove from the heat, squeeze out any excess moisture, and chop finely. In a bowl, mix the spinach with Greek yoghurt, crumbled feta, nutmeg, chopped dill, and plenty of black pepper.

Spread the spinach-yoghurt mixture onto a plate. Slice the soft-boiled eggs in half and place them on top. Sprinkle with mixed seeds and pomegranate seeds, if using. Serve with a warm wholemeal pita for scooping.

One-Pot 30 Minute Mushroom Bolognese ‍
 
+ some extra mushroom goodness in the form of M&S’s YAY! Mushroom range. They’ve paired up with Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew to bring out lions’ mane and reishi drinks!
 
Ingredients
      •     1 tbsp olive oil
      •     1 onion
      •     2 garlic cloves
      •     2 carrots
      •     2 celery sticks
      •     300g chestnut mushrooms pulsed in a blender
      •     1 tsp dried oregano
      •     1 tsp dried thyme
      •     2 tbsp tomato paste
      •     1 can (400g) chopped tomatoes
      •     1 can (400g) tinned lentils, drained and rinsed
      •     500ml vegetable stock
      •     100ml red wine (optional)
      •     1 tbsp soy sauce
      •     1 bay leaf (optional)
      •     250g dry pasta
      •     500ml water, as needed
      •     Salt and black pepper, to taste
      •     Fresh parsley, chopped, for garnish
      •     Parmesan or nutritional yeast, for serving (optional)
 
Method
      1.    Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, carrots, and celery. Sauté for 5-7 minutes until softened.
      2.    Add the chopped chestnut mushrooms and cook for 8-10 minutes until they release their liquid and brown slightly. (To save time you can add all vegetables at the same time)
      3.    Stir in oregano, thyme and tomato paste. Cook for 1-2 minutes to combine. If using, pour in red wine and let it simmer until reduced by half.
      4.    Add the chopped tomatoes, tinned lentils, vegetable stock & soy sauce. Stir to combine.
      5.    Add the dry pasta directly to the pot. Pour in enough water to just cover the pasta (about 500ml). Stir well and bring the mixture to a boil.
      6.    Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10-12 minutes, stirring frequently to prevent sticking. Add more water if the mixture becomes too thick before the pasta is fully cooked.
      7. Once the pasta is cooked and the sauce is thickened, remove the bay leaf and adjust seasoning with salt and black pepper.
      8.    Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley and grated Parmesan or nutritional yeast, if you like!

Now if there’s one thing you need with Dawn’s decadent desserts, it’s a good after-dinner cocktail… and I’ve got just the ticket – my signature Sloe Royale, made with my @cygnet_gin Welsh Dry Gin  And it couldn’t be easier to make!
 
SLOE ROYALE (makes two!)
• 37.5ml Cygnet Welsh Dry Gin
• 25ml M&S 16 Acres Sloe Gin
• 2 tsp orange brandy liqueur
• 25ml fresh lemon juice
• M&S Champagne Delacourt Medium Dry, to top up
• Blackberries, to garnish
 
1. Combine the Cygnet Welsh Dry Gin, sloe gin, orange brandy liqueur and fresh lemon juice in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake until mixed and well chilled.
2. Strain the mixture between two coupe glasses.
3. Top up each glass with the champagne.
4. Garnish with a single blackberry in each glass.
